commitResults.messageTitle: feat(level-0): rename chatbot to Planit and implement greeting and exit
refactor(level-0): split main method into greet and exit methods
Update README.md to match actual product name
Implement Echo class to repeat user input
Add playGame method to Planit class
commitResults.messageBody:
Planit task management system has multiple features (echoing user input
and managing tasks).

Keeping all the logic in main method makes it hard to read.

Creating a separate method for playing a game improves code readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Task and TaskList classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The Task class includes attributes to define individual tasks, while
the TaskList class stores all tasks and manages related methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create manageTask method in Planit Class
Rename TaskList.java to TaskManager.java and implement marking of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Methods inside TaskList.java like addTask should not be static as it
does not affect other instances of TaskList object.

Rename TaskList.java to TaskManager.java and move static manageTask
method from Planit class to non-static run method of TaskManager class.

Update other attributes and methods in TaskManager class as non-static.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Javadoc comments at appropriate places
Create subclasses, Todo, Deadline and Event for Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
There are different types of tasks that have some common behaviors
(e.g. toString()) and attributes (e.g. description, isDone).

Extracting the common behavior into a super class allows us to use
polymorphism.

Let's assign Task class as a parent class and create three other
subclasses. Using inheritance is preferable in this situation to
avoid code duplication.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement task creation feature
Move task-related methods from TaskManager to new TaskList class
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskManager handles both user input and task management, violating the
single responsibility principle.

Extracting methods like addTask, displayAllTasks, and toggleTaskStatus
into TaskList improves modularity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update testing to include task creation and mark/unmarking tasks
Planit class: remove method PlayGame
Add UI class for user input and message display
Create CommandType enum to define task-related commands
Make Task class abstract
commitResults.messageBody:
Task has three subclasses: Todo, Deadline, and Event.
Since tasks must belong to one of these types, making Task abstract
prevents instantiation of generic tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Parser class to process user input
Add error handling for invalid user input
Add EmptyCommandException for incomplete arguments
Merge branch 'branch-Level-5'
Reorganize classes into appropriate Java packages
Merge branch 'branch-A-Packages'
Update text-ui-test to include error handling
Use Java Collections to manage task list
Implement task deletion functionality
Add Storage class to save tasks in hard disk
Implement saving tasks to disk
Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Use Java Path objects for cross-platform file path management
Refactor TaskList to use a Map for task storage by type
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's replace the single ArrayList<Task> with a
Map<String, ArrayList<Task>> to categorize tasks by type (todo,
deadline, event).

This improves task retrieval and makes it easier to display tasks
categorized by type.
